div1.p: Truby confirms that Agramonte did not visit Lazear when he was sick nor did he attend the funeral.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, March 21, 1941
div1.opener:
Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
March 21 / 41
Dear Dr Hench:
div1.p:
Your special delivery letter has
just been delivered and I hasten to
answer re, the two buildings at Camp
Lazear. No, I did not see them in
1906, as I was suddenly sent back
to S.F. Prof. Guiteras gave a lecture
on yellow fever in Havana for the
benefit of the large number of Medical
Officers who were there with troops in
Oct. 1906. I think about 50 of us
were present and, among other things,
he urged every one of us to visit
Camp Lazear, groups of Medical Officers
did visit the place and some of them told me
what they saw. I will try to verify
that. zun zun equi told you the truth.
Both buildings were still there.

The large maps of Columbia Bks are here.
I was much interested in the key. The hospital
buildings were used for entirely different purposes
then in 1907 than they were in 1900. Their problems
were different
AC
T
and their medical personnel much larger.
Hence almost every building, except the ward
buildings, were used for quarters for the personnel.
Reed's Lab. and even the morgue were used for
quarters. Capt. Little M.C. lived in Lazear's house.
“Capt Truby” was my cousin W.F. Truby.
I lived at the post in quarters 5with six
other medical officers attached to my
Company (Co. B. Hosp. Corps).

Will be glad to all the note book with
photostatic articles. I think that I can
give you some light on some of those things.
Agramonte did not visit Lazear while he
was sick and did not attend the funeral.
This is of course confidential and I hope
it can be explained by Agramontes being
away from Havana at the time. This reminds
me of Pinto again. Have you written to him?

I am very anxious to have him tell
me just when he left Columbia Bks; and
I am after his views on a few other
things, but don't want to write him until
after you hear from him. So please
drop me a line on this before you
sail for Cuba.

Give my best regards to Moran. I think that
he feels that I am not friendly towards him.
He is wrong about that if he feels that way.
